Description.val:
The FY 2019 funding request was reduced by $.158 million to reflect the Department of Navy's effort to support the Office of Management and Budget directed reforms for Efficiency and Effectiveness that include a lean, accountable, more efficient government.

This funding procures long-lead major end items and sub-component kits required for repairs to both variants of Littoral Combat Ships (LCS). The items procured mitigate major long-lead replacement times due to system failures and casualties and increases availability of vital Fleet assets by reducing repair part procurement and delivery times. Funding procures support equipment, required ancillary equipment, and associated engineering and technical support services for LCS.

LN001 - LCS Battle Spares
This line procures shore-based battle spares, ensuring their availability in the event of a failure or major casualty to key systems. Systems that require shore-based spares include gas turbines, diesel engines and generators, propulsion systems, reduction gears, auxiliary propulsion units (APUs), machinery plant control & monitoring systems (MPCMSs), C5I, and Combat Systems. Inventory objectives are determined by the LCS Reliability, Maintainability, and Availability (RMA) data, NAVSEA RMA guidance, the critical application of equipment, and input from the NAVSEA 05 Technical community. 

LN002 - LCS Water Jet Spares
Both LCS variants are propelled by water jets; this line procures spare water jets and water jet components.  There are two LCS designs, the FREEDOM variant and the INDEPENDENCE variant, each using four water jets. The FREEDOM variant uses Rolls-Royce water jets and the INDEPENDENCE variant uses Wartsila Lips water jets.  The water jet assemblies are mounted externally on the ships' transom. These items will be designated 2S cog material and support a rotable pool for life cycle sustainment. In the event of a casualty, the water jets are removed and sent to a depot to be repaired. 

LN003 - Engineering Services
This funding provides engineering and technical support for LCS Class Support Equipment.  Services include the establishment of Technical Data Packages (TDPs) and the creation of associated depot level repair parts lists/installation requirements. Funding is also provided for Non-Recurring Engineering (NRE) and Design Services Allocation (DSA) modernization efforts tied to the ship availabilities.  

LN004 - Habitability Modification
Habitability Modifications include updating permanent berthing spaces, refrigeration (chill and freeze), dry provision stores, potable water, solid waste storage, and laundry for both FREEDOM and INDEPENDENCE variants. 

LN005 - LCS Ships Class Safety Design Changes
Safety modifications include the redesigned stern ramp for the FREEDOM variant ships to support 11M Rigid Hull Inflatable Boats (RHIB) operations and the installation of bridge wing for safe and effective operation on the INDEPENDENCE variant ships.
In FY18, the budget for the LCS Ships Class Safety Design Changes was realigned to LI 1604, LCS In-Service Modernization.

LN006 - LCS Ships Class Ancillary Equipment
This funding procures the connective equipment necessary to ensure fit and function of procured LCS Class Support Equipment when installed.

LN007 - AFSB SOF MODs
This funding procures the 3-D Air Search Radar to modify the Mobile Landing Platform-Afloat Forward Staging Base (MLP-AFSB) (Expeditionary Mobile Base, ESB) to support Special Operations Forces (SOF) requirements.

The FY 2019 funding request was reduced by $15.0 million to account for the availability of prior year execution balances.

Justification.val:
LN001 - LCS Battle Spares
This line procures shore-based battle spares to ensure availability of these assets in the event of a casualty to key systems. FY19 procurement of 2 Main Propulsion Diesel Engines (MPDE) and 3 Ship Service Diesel Generator (SSDG) for the INDEPENDENCE variant is necessary to reach inventory objective levels.  Procurement of the INDEPENDENCE variant Twin Boom Extensible Crane (TBEC) is based on the different configuration for LCS 6AF. FY19 FREEDOM procurements also include 1 Launch Recovery and Handling System (LRHS), 1 Main Propulsion Diesel Engine (MPDE),  2 Ship Service Diesel Generator (SSDG), 1 FCS 57 (Gun Fire Control System replacing the DORNA GFCS on LCS 5 AF), 1 GIC Fire Control System, 2 Auxiliary Propulsion Units and 2 Star Safire III. 

LN002 - LCS Water Jet Spares 
LCS water jets procurements will support the establishment of a rotable pool to replace assets during CNO availabilities.  Increase in procurement of water jets provides adequate ready for issue (RFI) assets to quickly remove/replace/repair actions for CNO Availabilities to begin in FY 19.  The rotable pool enables efficiencies and allows for decreased dry-dock time periods to address water jet repairs. The removed assets will be repaired and placed into the available pool of assets to support future LCS CNO Availabilities. Water Jet variation in component costs are a result of five (5) different configuration and two (2) Original Equipment Manufacturers (Rolls Royce & Wartsilla): LCS 1/3, LCS 5AF, LCS 2, LCS 4 and LCS 6AF.  The quantities support the different configurations and support of the planned ship availabilities. 

LN003 - Engineering Services
This funding provides engineering and technical support for LCS Class Support Equipment develops Technical Data Packages (TDPs) and creates associated depot level repair parts lists/installation requirements.

LN004 - Habitability Modification
Habitability Modifications (racks, increased provisioning stowage, solid waste stowage, laundry capacity and potable water) to increase permanent berthing to 98 for FREEDOM and INDEPENDENCE variants to be installed during the Post Shakedown Availability (PSA) period.

LN005 - LCS Ships Class Safety Design Changes
Safety modifications include the redesigned stern ramp for the FREEDOM variant ships to support 11M Rigid Hull Inflatable Boats (RHIB) operations and the installation of bridge wing for safe and effective operation on the INDEPENDENCE variant ships during the PSA period.

LN006 - LCS Ships Class Ancillary Equipment
This funding procures the connective equipment necessary to ensure fit and function of procured Class Support Equipment when installed.

LN007 - AFSB SOF MODs
This funding procures the 3-D Air Search Radar to modify the Mobile Landing Platform-Afloat Forward Staging Base (MLP-AFSB) (Expeditionary Mobile Base, ESB) to support Special Operations Forces (SOF) requirements.
